metadata.questionText: \text{What is the standard method}\\[0.5em]\text{for solving 3Ã—3 linear}\\[0.5em]\text{systems by hand?}
metadata.explanation: Row reduction (Gaussian elimination) is the standard systematic method. It transforms the augmented matrix [A|b] into row echelon form, making it easy to solve by back-substitution. This method works for systems of any size and reveals whether there's a unique solution, no solution, or infinite solutions.
